subject: History
title: Cracking the Rosetta Stone
description: A quick win: understand Cracking the Rosetta Stone.

hook.text: For over a thousand years, nobody on Earth could read Egyptian hieroglyphs. The knowledge was gone.

buildup.text: In 1799, French soldiers in Egypt found a stone slab with the same text in three scripts.

twist.text: He cracked the code in 1822 by matching the name Ptolemy in Greek and hieroglyphic scripts.

climax.text: Suddenly, 3,000 years of silent monuments could speak. An entire civilization's voice returned.

punchline.text: One stone gave a dead language its voice back.

quiz.question: How did Champollion crack the hieroglyphic code?
options: He found a hidden translation manual in a tomb
He matched royal names between Greek and hieroglyphic scripts
He deciphered the pictographic meanings of each symbol
